title: What did websites look like in early 90s? - Quora
tags: History of the World Wide Web

response.answer_text: Depending on the type of website eg personal or commercial - and the period in the 90s eg 1995 or 1999 - here are some general characteristics: Narrow page width by today's standards. Screens were no wider than 800 pixelsSparing use of graphics. Many people were on dial-up connections and large and more detailed images could take over a minute to download.Limited variety of fonts. Usually a browser sans or serif.Flash splash screens were fairly ubiquitous. Web pages were thought of as similar to television adverts with a captive audience.

You can check them out for yourself at Internet Archive: Wayback Machine. It was mostly text (using too many images make the whole site slow to load), no CSS, animated GIFs, comic sans (and other strange fonts) and frames! For the record, I did go through a comic sans phase.
